newsitem.title: USA: GKN incurs $600 mln U.S. court judgement.
newsitem.headline: GKN incurs $600 mln U.S. court judgement.

text.p: A U.S. District Court on Thursday awarded franchisees of Meineke Discount Muffler Shops, a unit of British engineering group GKN Plc, $600,969,788 in damages and interest in a four-year-old lawsuit over advertising payments.
Lawyers for the franchisees said U.S. District Court Judge Robert Potter had trebled a jury's December 18 verdict against GKN of about $197 million in compentsatory damages.

C.K. Chow, GKN chief executive, told Reuters in an interview earlier Thursday that the company had not yet made any provision for the judgement. But he also said GKN believed it had a very strong case for appealing a judgement.
The franchisee lawyers said the lawsuit first filed in 1993 arose out of Meineke's handling of an advertising fund, which took in 10 percent of the franchisee revenues.

The franchisees argued during the trial that Meineke should have simply acted as a conduit for the advertising funds but instead created an in-house advertising agency and kept millions of dollars for itself.
A spokesman for Meineke was not immediately available to comment. But Mark Zuckerman, president of the Association of Meineke Dealers, said: "We are very pleased with the court's decision.
